body:
I have just checked min and max values for t1 trend scanning variable. Max value is 235 and min value -208.

Without data it's hard to identify the problem.

@segatrade Thank you for reporting this issue!

I've looked into the code and it's written as intended in the **Advances in Financial Machine Learning** by _Lopez de Prado_ (page 258).

The issue here is that for some regressions the variations of betas were too small resulting in high SADF estimates. 
![sadf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16906989/88802245-16c76300-d1ab-11ea-9bbd-73d684834f59.png)
[Reference](https://mlfinlab.readthedocs.io/en/latest/implementations/structural_breaks.html#supremum-augmented-dickey-fuller)

A solution to this can be increasing the minimum sample length (setting it to 6 already removes the high negative SADF value at 2019-12-18 19:03 observation).
maybe penalize by n sqrt(sigma), or something like it (standard error) ?

In this case, I'd say that penalizing would need to be adjusted for this specific problem, as the anomaly numbers are pretty high in relation to the standard ones. Different datasets and input variables would require different penalization adjustments, so I don't think it's a good option to add one general penalization method here.

An option would be to install mlfinlab package locally using `pip install -e mlfinlab` and adjust `get_betas` function in `mlfinlab/structural_breaks/sadf.py`

Let me know if you'll be playing around with it and will come to a general solution ðŸ™‚
you told about sadf, but the problem is t-value of linreg (labelling function)

@rspadim But the t-value is calculated from the mean and std from `get_betas` function of the `sadf.py`

https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/blob/1d26d6d436d9ee5122d34ea471e09fd927bb94ac/mlfinlab/labeling/trend_scanning.py#L62-L69
In this case `n sqrt(sigma)` wouldn't fix such big anomalies as -107375. I mean, which general penalization method do you think would fit here?

sorry now i checked https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/blob/master/mlfinlab/structural_breaks/sadf.py#L152
it's already the standard error (shape adjusted)

the "best" penalization is the window size, no solution here

other option is use of inverse entropy or entropy of t-values instead directly t-values, or other rank method to "normalize"/"standardize" the vector of numbers

others possibilities is filter the t-value series: kalman / moving averages, but the effect is near to change window sizes

thanks @PanPip , now I got the point here

Thanks @rspadim ðŸ™‚ 

I guess this issue is solved now.
